DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy T2 Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Abnormality Administered Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The dose related to the administration of radiation therapy to a T2/FLAIR (Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery) abnormality.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy T2 Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Abnormality Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the administration of radiation therapy to a T2/FLAIR (Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery) abnormality.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: Time Integer::2 Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Abnormality Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.:A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.
A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
